and development of machine learning language models 1 tools ● size b / 2 25 mm hook ● 6 + straight needle ● size g / 4 25 mm hook ● split-ring or removable stitch markers ● tapestry/darning needle materials ● worsted weight yarn ○ underbody 200+ yds / 185+ m ○ plate 240+ yds / 220+ m ○ mask 30+ yds / 28+ m ● super fine/sock weight yarn ○ large eyes 10+ yds / 9+ m ○ small eyes 10+ yds / 9+ m ● polyfil pattern notes ● the finished piece is approximately 17 long when made with the recommended tools and materials ● all parts of this pattern are worked using the yarn-over technique and in joined rounds connected with slip_stitch + chain 1 unless otherwise stated ● stitches are described using us terminology/notation ● the seamless stitching technique is used in this pattern to preserve a clean edge on some parts during assembly watch this video for an explanation of whip vs seamless stitching in amigurumi stitch key stitch key a x # repeat a in parentheses # times a work a stitches in single stitch space blo work in back loops of stitches st stitch chain chain magic_ring magic_ring slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet triple crochet increase single_crochet increase triple single_crochet increase 3 single_crochet in same stitch space decrease invisible single_crochet decrease through front loops of stitches decrease reg normal single_crochet decrease triple single_crochet decrease 3 single_crochet decrease i e sc3tog half_double_crochet decrease half_double_crochet decrease 2 i skip one stitch ii thread yarn tail under both loops of next available stitch iii thread yarn between the front and back loops of the stitch the yarn tail originated
